fields.name: username
fields.description: Username of the user

fields.name: password
fields.description: Password of the user

records.name: BasicAuth
records.description: A record for providing `BasicAuth` related configurations

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: Supported FTP protocols

fields.name: host
fields.description: Target service URL

fields.name: port
fields.description: Port number of the remote service

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: Authenthication options

fields.name: path
fields.description: Relative file path for newly added file

fields.name: size
fields.description: Size of the file

fields.name: lastModifiedTimestamp
fields.description: Last modified timestamp of the file in UNIX Epoch time

fields.name: name
fields.description: File name

fields.name: isFolder
fields.description: Whether the file is a folder or not

fields.name: isFile
fields.description: Whether the file is a file or not

fields.name: pathDecoded
fields.description: The normalized absolute path of this file, within its file system

fields.name: extension
fields.description: The extension of this file name

fields.name: publicURIString
fields.description: The receiver as a URI String for public display

fields.name: fileType
fields.description: File's type

fields.name: isAttached
fields.description: Whether the fileObject is attached

fields.name: isContentOpen
fields.description: Whether someone reads/writes to this file

fields.name: isExecutable
fields.description: Whether this file is executable

fields.name: isHidden
fields.description: Whether this file is hidden

fields.name: isReadable
fields.description: Whether this file can be read

fields.name: isWritable
fields.description: Whether this file can be written to

fields.name: depth
fields.description: The depth of this file name, within its file system

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The URI scheme of this file

fields.name: uri
fields.description: The absolute URI of this file

fields.name: rootURI
fields.description: The root URI of the file system this file belongs to

fields.name: friendlyURI
fields.description: A "friendly path", this is a path without a password

records.name: FileInfo
records.description: This provides metadata information for newly added files.

fields.name: filePath
fields.description: Path of the file to create/append to

fields.name: isFile
fields.description: True if input type is a file

fields.name: fileContent
fields.description: The content read from the input file, if the input is a file

fields.name: textContent
fields.description: The input content, for other input types

fields.name: compressInput
fields.description: If true, input will be compressed before upload

records.name: InputContent
records.description: Provides configuration for the input given for FTP `put` and `append` operations

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path to the keystore file

fields.name: password
fields.description: Keystore password

records.name: KeyStore
records.description: A record for providing `Keystore` related configurations

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: Supported FTP protocols

fields.name: host
fields.description: Target service url

fields.name: port
fields.description: Port number of the remote service

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: Authentication options

fields.name: path
fields.description: Remote FTP directory location

fields.name: fileNamePattern
fields.description: File name pattern that event need to trigger

fields.name: pollingInterval
fields.description: Periodic time interval to check new update

fields.name: cronExpression
fields.description: Cron expression to check new update

fields.name: serverConnector
fields.description: Server connector for service

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path to the private key file

fields.name: password
fields.description: Private key password

records.name: PrivateKey
records.description: A record for providing `PrivateKey` related configurations

fields.name: trustStore
fields.description: Configures the truststore to be used

fields.name: keyStore
fields.description: Configures the keystore to be used

fields.name: basicAuth
fields.description: Configure username/password to be used

fields.name: privateKey
fields.description: Configures the private key to be used

records.name: SecureSocket
records.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote FTP server

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path to the truststore file

fields.name: password
fields.description: Truststore password

records.name: TrustStore
records.description: A record for providing `Truststore` related configurations

fields.name: addedFiles
fields.description: Array of FileInfo that represents newly added files

fields.name: deletedFiles
fields.description: Array of string that contains deleted file names

records.name: WatchEvent
records.description: This represents the latest status change of the server from the last status change.

returnParameters.description:
A ReadableByteChannel that represents the data source to the
           resource or an `error` if failed to establish communication
           with the FTP server or read the resource

remoteMethods.name: get
remoteMethods.description:
The `get()` function can be used to retrieve file content from a remote
resource.
```ballerina
    # io:ReadableByteChannel|error channel = client->get(path);
    # ```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written to the file in server

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
           server

remoteMethods.name: append
remoteMethods.description:
The `append()` function can be used to append content to an existing file
in an FTP server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = client->append(path, channel);
    # ```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written to the file in server

parameters.name: compressInput
parameters.description: True if file should be compressed before uploading

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
           server

remoteMethods.name: put
remoteMethods.description:
The `put()` function can be used to add a file to an FTP server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = client->put(path, channel);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
           server

remoteMethods.name: mkdir
remoteMethods.description:
The `mkdir()` function can be used to create a new direcotry in an FTP
server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = client->mkdir(path);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
           server

remoteMethods.name: rmdir
remoteMethods.description:
The `rmdir()` function can be used to delete an empty directory in an FTP
server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = client->rmdir(path);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
           server

remoteMethods.name: rename
remoteMethods.description:
The `rename()` function can be used to rename a file or move to a new
location within the same FTP server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = client->rename(origin, destination);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The file size in bytes or an `error` if failed to establish
           communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: size
remoteMethods.description:
The `size()` function can be used to get the size of a file resource.
```ballerina
    # int|error response = client->size(path);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An array of file names or an `error` if failed to establish
           communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: list
remoteMethods.description:
The `list()` function can be used to get the file name list in a given
folder.
```ballerina
    # ftp:FileInfo[]|error response = client->list(path);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
true if given resource is a direcotry or an `error` if failed
           to establish communication with the FTP server

remoteMethods.name: isDirectory
remoteMethods.description:
The `isDirectory()` function can be used to check if a given resource is a
direcotry.
```ballerina
    # boolean|error response = client->isDirectory(path);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
            server

remoteMethods.name: delete
remoteMethods.description:
The `delete()` function can be used to delete a file from an FTP server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = client->delete(path);
    # ```

clients.name: Client
clients.description: Represents an FTP client that intracts with an FTP server

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `error` upon failure to register the listener

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description:
Binds a service to the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->attach(service1);
    # ```

methods.name: init
methods.description: Gets invoked during object initialization.

returnParameters.description: () or else `error` upon failure to start the listener

methods.name: 'start
methods.description:
Starts the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->start();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: () or else `error` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: __stop
methods.description:
Stops the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->__stop();
    # ```

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `error` upon failure to register the listener

methods.name: attach
methods.description:
Binds a service to the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->attach(service1);
    # ```

parameters.name: emailService
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `error` upon failure to detach the service

methods.name: detach
methods.description:
Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the `ftp:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->detach(service1);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else a `error` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description:
Stops the `ftp:Listener` forcefully.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->immediateStop();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: () or else `error` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description:
Stops the `ftp:Listener` gracefully.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->gracefulStop();
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
           server

methods.name: poll
methods.description:
Poll new files from a FTP server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->poll();
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An `error` if failed to establish communication with the FTP
           server

methods.name: register
methods.description:
Register a FTP service in an FTP listener
server.
```ballerina
    # error? response = listener->register(ftpService, name);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: () or else `error` upon failure to start the listener
() or else `error` upon failure to stop the listener

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents a service listener that monitors the FTP location.

types.name: Protocol
types.description: Represents the set of protocols supported by the FTP listener and client

packages.name: ftp
packages.summary: This module provides an FTP client and an FTP server listener implementation to facilitate an FTP connection to a remote location.
